question.text: Catalyst A reduces the activation energy for a reaction by <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>10</mn><mo> </mo><mi>kJ</mi><msup><mrow><mo> </mo><mi>mol</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> at <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>300</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math>. The ratio of rate constants, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></msub><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mi>Catalysed</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></msub><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mi>Uncatalysed</mi></mrow></mfrac></math> is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi></msup></math>. The value of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi></math> is____[nearest integer] [Assume that the pre-exponential factor is same in both the cases. Given <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>31</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi><msup><mrow><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mo> </mo><mi>mol</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>]

solution.text:
Arrhenius equation for the rate constant of a reaction in terms of energy of activation is given by

K=Ae-EaRT

Kcatalyst=AeEa'RT

Kuncatalysed=Ae-EaRT

KcatalystKUncatalysed=eEa-Ea'RT=e10×10008.314×300=e4

data.bucket: Must Do Ques (JEE Main) - Any Difficulty
